option.text: Take needle in hand with which you are going to be broaching
Take needle in hand with which you are NOT going to be broaching
Remove protective cap from needle
Remove protective cap from needle
Inject blood vessel at an angle above 45 degree
Inject blood vessel at an angle of 30°
Place the thumb of the other hand ± 5 cm below the puncture site and pull the skin
Pierce the bloodvessel
Take off the tourniquet
Pierce the blood vessel at an angle of 30° with respect to the skin, with the concave side of the needle facing up
Pierce the blood vessel at an angle of 45° with respect to the skin, with the concave side of the needle facing up
Pierce the blood vessel at an angle of 90° with respect to the skin, with the concave side of the needle facing up
Place the dry sterile gauze folded (cloth) at the puncture site; do not apply pressure
Place the dry sterile gauze (cloth) folded at the puncture site; Apply pressure
Remove needle
Remove needle and apply pressure on gauze(cloth) on puncture site
Remove needle and do not apply pressure on gauze (cloth)
Put band aid on puncture point
Fixate the gauze(cloth) with the bandaid
Do not place a band-aid on gauze
